revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=February 2013}} {{cleanup|date=April 2012|reason=introduction doesn't have the info it should have, some random unnotable info is strewn about, various parts of article need to wikified}} }} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Crash Boom Bang | Image = [[File:CBB.jpeg]] | caption = Crash Boom Bang performing at [[James Madison University]] on April 4, 2012. | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Fairfax, Virginia]], U.S. | genre = [[Pop rock]] | years_active = 1999 - present | label = Unsigned | associated_acts = | website = | current_members = Omar Ruiz
Chaucer Hwang
Raul Rivero
Mauricio Rivero }} '''Crash Boom Bang''' is an [[United States|American]] [[pop rock]] band based in [[Northern Virginia]]. The band members are two brothers, Mauricio and Raul Rivero, as well as Omar Ruiz and Chaucer Hwang. They have appeared in productions and publications such as ''[[Alternative Press]]'' and [[MTV]]’s ''[[The City (MTV series)|The City]]''. ==History== The name Crash Boom Bang originates from a "tentative lyric in one of [their] songs", that lead singer Omar Ruiz suggested become the band’s name. In the band’s eyes, the name was fitting because they "wanted something memorable that could describe [their] music at the same time". Raul Rivero, bass guitarist, and Mauricio Rivero, drummer, are brothers. They attended [[J.E.B. Stuart High School]] in [[Falls Church, Virginia]].{{cite news|last=Scott|first=Ellen|title=Behind the Scenes Photos: Local Band Films Music Video at District Underground|url=http://arlington.wusa9.com/photo-gallery/super-nova/77566-behind-scenes-photos-local-band-films-music-video-district-underground.|newspaper=W*USA9|date=October 26, 2011}} Chaucer Hwang was originally from [[Florida]], but has lived in Northern Virginia for around 10{{when|date=June 2015}} years. The lead singer, Omar Ruiz, attended [[McLean High School]]. Crash Boom Bang are friends with the popular band, [[Plain White T’s]]. Mauricio Rivero has known the lead singer, [[Tom Higgenson]], since before Plain White T’s achieved widespread fame.DeLaura, Amy. "Up and Coming: Crash Boom Bang", ''Mace and Crown'', November 16, 2011. Higgenson invited the band to appear for a few shows on the Plain White T’s Every Second Counts Tour in 2007. Crash Boom Bang shared a stage with Plain White T’s in 2008 and 2009, as well as [[Mayday Parade]]. While performing and touring with Plain White T’s, Higgenson produced Crash Boom Bang’s first full-length album, ''Gold Rush''. However, Crash Boom Bang is currently{{when|date=June 2015}} not signed to a record label. ==Musical style and influence== Crash Boom Bang have been fans of a wide variety of artists, including [[Guns N’ Roses]], [[Maroon 5]] and [[Lady Gaga]]. They describe their music as "if [[Bruno Mars]] fronted [[Cobra Starship]]".[http://www.melodic.net/Index.php?page=interview&id=397 Hwang, Chaucer, and Mauricio Rivero. Interview by Alex Lupul. "Crash Boom Bang"]. Melodic Net, March 9, 2012. They have also been described as similar to [[Plain White T’s]], [[Boys Night Out (band)|Boys Night Out]] and [[The Red Jumpsuit Apparatus]].Karan, Tim. "AP & R: Our Unsigned Bands of the Month", ''Alternative Press'', June 2009. ==Members== * Omar Ruiz – lead vocals, guitar * Chaucer Hwang – lead guitar * Raul Rivero – bass guitar, keyboard, backing vocals * Mauricio Rivero – drums, vocals ==Awards== * [[WUSA (TV)|W*USA 9]] selected Crash Boom Bang to be in its Best Local Bands A-List in 2006. * In 2008, Crash Boom Bang appeared again in W*USA 9’s list, which showcases over a thousand of Washington DC's "best local businesses" who are nominated by readers, and then voted for online.[http://washingtondc.cityvoter.com/crash-boom-bang/biz/6188 Cityvoter] ==In other media== * The band’s song "Are You Ready?" was used in the film ''[[American Pie Presents: The Book of Love]]''. * The band made a guest appearance on the TV show ''[[House of Carters]]'' in episode 4, "Two of a Carter". * They were featured in the June 2009 issue of ''Alternative Press'', in "Our Unsigned Bands of the Month". * On the October 27, 2009, episode 118 of the [[MTV]] show ''[[The City (MTV series)|The City]]'', "Are You Ready?" was played as some of the stars met to work out the details of an event at [[Longchamp (company)|Longchamp]].[http://www.mtv.com/shows/the-city/season_1/episode_music.jhtml?episodeID=160885 "Songs from the Show."] ==Discography== ===Albums=== '''''Gold Rush'''''
Released February 7, 2009 # "Are You Ready?" – 3:03 # "House" – 3:07 # "Let It Out" – 2:49 # "Dangerous" – 3:03 # "Science Fiction" – 3:25 # "It’s Only Me" – 3:24 # "Let Me Know" – 2:31 # "Devil In Disguise" – 2:42 # "Forever In Love" – 2:58 # "U & I" – 3:07 # "Thank You" – 2:54 ===EPs=== '''''Dangerous'''''
# "Are You Ready?" – 3:11 # "Dangerous" – 3:08 # "Let It Out" – 2:54 # "House" – 3:20 # "Devil In Disguise" – 3:05 # "Anniversary" – 3:22 '''''Surrender'''''
Released November 21, 2009 # "Surrender" – 2:36 # "Walk Down That Road" – 3:02 # "Good To Go" – 2:40 # "Spoke Too Soon" – 2:40 '''''These Wild Things'''''
Released October 3, 2011 # "Control" – 4:17 # "Hits" – 3:19 # "Yelling & Screaming" – 3:31 # "V.I.P." – 3:27 # "Hands Up" – 3:25 # "Save Me" – 2:51 ==Solo project== Ruiz released an EP titled, ''Ep'' under the name Crash Boom Omar on August 24, 2010. The tracks are "What You Really Need Is A Man That Will Sing For You", "Ready For Tomorrow", "Goodbyes" and "Magical". ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:American pop rock music groups]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 1999]] [[Category:1999 establishments in Virginia]]
